lines.text:
[angrily insulting Panisse]
Lecher!
What?
Eunuch!
Oh, Marius, be consistent. He can't be both.
Why weren't you at the dance last night?
Well, I can live without dancing.
I dance practically every dance with Victor. Very good dancer. Very polite and clever too.
Victor? Is he that little boy with the large pimples?
Oh the pimples are all gone now.
I'm glad to hear it.
They've been replaced by boils.
Do you know where I've just come from?

[Uneasy]
No.
Panisse's. I told him I could no marry him.
Are you sure you did the right thing?

[Panisse wants to marry Fanny]
She is forty years younger than you!
That is not my fault. I admit I am no spring chicken, but I also admit that I have six hundred thousand francs.
My poor Panisse...

[Looking at the new expedition preparing to sail out]
Some scientists! None of them a day over thirty-five!

[Torn between Fanny and his dream]
Fanny. Only you can stop me. Now tell me that you love me. Tell me now!

[Weeping]
Marius, I tell you... you are free to go.

[Heartbroken]
Alright. Then it's settled. Each to his love! You will marry Panisse's money, and I will marry the sea!
It's not dying I mind. It's giving up life that annoys me.

[First lines]
Full steam ahead!

[Indicating Marius' friend]
Is that coffee for him?
Yes. Want a cup?
No.
Why not?
Because if we drink everything free, there would be nothing left for the customers!

[his crewman is blowing the boat's whistle too long]
Enough, idiot! You're using up all the steam!
Your son is a lout! And with or without your permission I would kick him in the behind!

[Staring lovingly at the sea, and a sail boat coming into the harbour]
I want to be on that ship!
You know Marius, I think it's about time you got married.
Me? Why?
Now now, Marius. Don't take me for an idiot. I know you love Fanny.
Who told you?

[Sarcastic]
My little finger.
Then that little finger is not so bright.

[Talking to his son Marius]
You know, sometimes I say that you make my life miserable. It's not true.
